step_of_the_day.content:
Review and Appreciate: How well were you able to accept and love yourself? This is an ongoing process. Any
            effort puts you on The Path. At the “heart” of your Resilience Response is self-love. “Spread love everywhere you go. Let no one ever come to you without leaving happier.” —Mother Teresa Love is one of the most powerful forces in the universe. If this statement doesn’t ring true, if you are
            skeptical, it’s only because you haven’t given it a chance. We know that the deep feeling of love can
            trigger biochemical processes in the body that facilitate healing and positive feelings. It is associated
            with the release of oxytocin as well as dopamine and serotonin—often referred to as our “happy hormones.”
            You don’t need drugs to elicit this hormonal response. Love will do it. As Lennon and McCartney said, “Love
            is all you need.” Connect with the sense of love that you feel toward someone in your life. Take a few minutes to allow these
            feelings to move through your body and have an impact on you. The deeper you go, the greater the experience.
            And remember, you are in a developmental process. Accept your effort as part of that development, even when
            you are uncertain of the effect. Next, connect with that person and share your feelings. If this is
            difficult, do the best you can. Notice the positive results of this exercise. Write about your love of someone and how rewarding it feels to you.
